name: WineTag
overview:
WINETAG is the first Latin America’s Wine Social Network and has an unprecedented business model that is based on providing services for all companies that works in the wine business. WINETAG has a strong management team, top qualified TI Engineers ans a sizable long-term market opportunity.

Aiming at the concept of mobile computing, ubiquitous computing, Internet of Things and 2D codes to store information, the motivation came to the realization of this project, building a social network to carry information given by companyâ€™s experts and users at bottles of wine and places. The information is encoded in 2D codes like QR Code and is decoded by software using cellular phone cameras to access specific information.

The coded information to the QR Codes are collected through evaluations or descriptions of the technical specifications of the wine in a social network called WineTag, where users can also find friends, be followed by other participants, share their assessments and recommendations on other social networks (Facebook, Twitter ), and then, provide information where certain wines can be purchased or tasted.

This new social networking niche, focused on enogastronomy theme lets users to build a social graph that is different than the one that used to be built by major networks such as Facebook. Instead of connecting the users profiles to their friends, groups, photos and instant messaging, this new social graph connects people to things (wine, restaurants, wine shops, wineries, importers), thus creating a graph that can and must be connected to the graph of bigger social networks to generate recommendations and information about the” things “around the users and their friends.

The connections made in the graph shared between different social networks, micro blogs, sites, search engines, etc., and the ways that systems can cover the same from a particular user, allow the identification, personalization and customization of preferences user.
